resource.name: Metro Nashville Police Department Active Dispatch
resource.description: Current active major incident calls for service received by the Emergency Communications Center dispatched to Metro Nashville Police Department. Updated approximately every 15 minutes.
resource.attribution: Metro Nashville Police Department, Information Technology
columns_description: Date and time the call was answered by the ECC
Text description of the Incident Type Code
Abbreviated codes ("tencodes") used to represent common phrases describing the call
Additional location information for the call, if applicable
Street address where the call occurred
City, precinct, or neighborhood where the call occurred
Date and time the call status was last updated

resource.name: Nashville Fire Department Active Incidents
resource.description: A summary of active incidents under current response from the Nashville Fire Department.
columns_description: Identifier for the incident
Date and time of the dispatch
Identifier for units dispatched to the incident
Code for type of incident
ZIP code of the incident

resource.name: Building Permits Issued
resource.description: Details of building permits approved and issued by Metro Codes over a rolling three-year period.

ZIP Code of the parcel for the permit

The Assessor’s Parcel Number (APN) for the property the permit is issued for

Full text description of the permit type
Permit number
Metro Nashville council district number for the parcel
State of the parcel for the permit
Geocoded point location of the parcel with latitude and longitude for mapping purposes
Date the permit was applied for
Stated value of the construction
City of the parcel for the permit
The census tract information for the property
Legal description of the parcel for the permit
Street address of the parcel for the permit
Unique identifier for the permit
Short version of the permit type description
The stated purpose of the permit, which may contain boilerplate language appropriate for each permit type

resource.name: Metro Nashville Police Department Calls for Service
resource.description: Details about emergency and non-emergency calls for Metro Nashville Police Department service received by the Emergency Communications Center.
resource.attribution: Metro Nashville Police Department, Information Technology
columns_description: Text description of the disposition code
Text description of the call’s tencode suffix
MNPD incident number for the call, if an incident is generated for the call
Abbreviated codes used to represent common phrases used to describe the call
Code used to describe the outcome of the call
Rounded longitude for the call
Street name where the call occurred
Abbreviated codes used to provide additional information about the call beyond the tencode
MNPD reporting zone for the call
MNPD zone / patrol area for the call
Callsign of the officer responding to the call
Rounded latitude for the call
Rounded block number for the call

This column was automatically created in order to record in what polygon from the dataset 'Davidson County Border (GIS)' (wvby-4s8j) the point in column 'mapped_location' is located.  This enables the creation of region maps (choropleths) in the visualization canvas and data lens.

MNPD precinct assigned to the call
Text description of the call’s tencode

resource.name: Davidson County Cemetery Survey

resource.name: Library Facilities

resource.name: Sidewalk Inventory for ADA Self-Assessment
resource.description: Granular inventory points on the Metro Nashville public sidewalk network that describe defects, obstructions, or other relevant items that may affect ADA compliance of the pedestrian route.
columns_description: This is the unique route identifier of the sidewalk section.  It is described by the ONST, FROMST, TOST, Side fields that follow
The type of event/observation along the sidewalk route
A more detailed description of the object identified in the EVNT_TYPE observation
When the EVNT_TYPE=DRIVEWAY, this field describes the cross slope in percent grade of the sidewalk at the centerline of the driveway alignment at the intersection of the sidewalk path of travel.
When the EVNT_TYPE=SWATTRIBUTE, this field describes the type of curb (if any) adjacent to the sidewalk route
When the EVNT_TYPE=DRIVEWAY, this field describes the construction of the driveway where it ties into the sidewalk path of travel.
Indicates if the section of sidewalk has been repaired  and made ADA compliant subsequent to the collection of the observation
When the EVNT_TYPE=DRIVEWAY, this field describes the direction of the cross- slope downslope (TOROAD=Toward the public roadway; AWROAD=Away from the public roadway
The name of the street that the sidewalk route follows along (parallel to)
The name of the street that the sidewalk route ends (intersects at the ending point)
The distance along the sidewalk route from the starting point of the route to the event/observation described.
When the EVNT_TYPE=DRIVEWAY, this field describes if the sidewalk has a laydown to the driveway grade (Yes or No).
The WGS 84 Latitude of the location of the event/observation in decimal degrees

Because observation may be linear, the EVENT_SUBT will describe if the specific observation is a point only, or the beginning or ending of a linear event.  Some event types are inferred to be points and thus this field may not be populated for many events.  This field also identifies if STORMGRATES in the roadway are Bike friendly or not.
When the EVNT_TYPE=SWATTRIBUTE, this field describes the material of which the sidewalk is constructed.
When the EVNT_TYPE=SWATTRIBUTE, this field describes the width of the sidewalk furnishing zone in feet.
When the EVNT_TYPE=SWATTRIBUTE, , this field describes the cross slope in percent grade of the sidewalk at the given measure
For POLES, BOXES, STORMGRATES, this field describes the resulting path of travel of the sidewalk taking into account the obstruction.
In cases of overhead obstructions of the path of travel, this field describes the resulting path of travel taking into account the obstruction
Combined latitude and longitude of event/observation for mapping purposes
When the EVNT_TYPE=SWATTRIBUTE, this field describes the width of the sidewalk in feet.
When the EVNT_TYPE=SWATTRIUTE, this field describes the direction of the cross-slope downslope
The name of the street that the sidewalk route begins (intersects at the starting point)
Side of the street (ONST) that the sidewalk route is located on
The WGS 84 Longitude of the location of the event/observation in decimal degrees

The data is for the fiscal year ending June 30 of the applicable year.
